intro: Bulbostylis eleocharoides, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. This plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and colonize new areas. The plant is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
